Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk hyperv-daemons
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: hyperv-daemons bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The hyperv-daemons packages provide a suite of daemons that are needed when a Red Hat Enterprise Linux guest is running on Microsoft Hyper-V. The following daemons are included: hypervkvpd, the guest Hyper-V Key-Value Pair (KVP) daemon hypervvssd, the implementation of Hyper-V VSS functionality hypervfcopyd, the implementation of Hyper-V file copy service functionality This update fixes the following bugs: Using the online backup feature on read-only file systems that do not support system freezing, for example SquashFS, failed with an "Operation not supported" error. This update fixes the hypervvssd daemon to handle the online backup correctly, and the described error no longer occurs. (BZ#1160584) Previously, on a virtual machine managed by the Microsoft Hyper-V hypervisor, the hypervvssd daemon did not detect partitions that were mounted more than once, for example when a partition was mounted simultaneously to several different mount points. Consequently, the Windows Backup tool failed to back up the data of such virtual machines. With this update, the hypervvssd daemon has been fixed to detect partitions even if they were mounted more than once. As a result, using the Windows Backup tool on machines with such configuration now succeeds. (BZ#1169724) Users of hyperv-daemons are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
